Name: Charge Reactions
Description:
When a unit has a Charge declared against it must immediately perform a Charge Reaction. The owner of the charged unit declares which Charge Reaction, and resolve the effects immediately. There are two <u><link="charge_reactions">Charge Reactions</link></u> to choose from:
-   Hold!: This is the default Charge Reaction. Choosing the Hold! Charge Reaction means the unit stands its ground and makes no further action.
-   Flee!: A unit can select this Charge Reaction only once per phase, and only if not already <u><link="engaged_in_combat">Engaged in Combat</link></u>. The unit is pivoted to face directly away from the Centre of the charging unit, it then performs a <u><link="flee_move">Flee Move</link></u> (see <u><link="psychology">Psychology</link></u> section).
-   If this <u><link="flee_move">Flee Move</link></u> brings the fleeing unit into contact with a unit that declared a Charge against it this phase, the fleeing unit is immediately <u><link="removed">removed</link></u> as a casualty.
-   Remember <u><link="flee_move">Flee Moves</link></u> due to Charge Reaction Flee! do not cause a Panic Test in friendly units that the Fleeing unit moves through (unless caused by a failed Panic Test when charged by a unit containing <u><link="rulebook-terror">Terror)</link></u>.

Name: Manifestation
Description: During Pre-game Selections, each Exalted Herald must choose two different <u><link="manifestation">Manifestations</link></u> from the list below and apply the effects during the game. The model must select two spells out of those indicated for the chosen <u><link="manifestation">Manifestations</link></u>, Wrath of God (Thaumaturgy), and Hellfire (Hereditary Spell). This replaces the normal rules for Spell Selection connected to being a Wizard Adept.

Name: Chilling Yawn
Description: Enemy units in base contact with one or more models with this <u><link="manifestation">Manifestation</link></u> suffer -2 Agility.

Name: Scent of Blood
Description: Charge Range rolls made by units entirely with <u><link="de-scent_of_blood">Scent of Blood</link></u> gain Maximised if  the target of the Charge contains a Health Pool that has fewer Health Points than its starting value.

Name: Meeting of Minds
Description: The model gains <u><link="de-scent_of_blood">Scent of Blood</link></u> and treats all friendly models with Beast as <u><link="rulebook-insignificant">Insignificant</link></u>.

Name: Artistry of Death
Description: Standard Melee Attacks gain +1 to wound.

Name: First Strike
Description: During the First Round of Combat, <u><link="model">model</link></u> parts with <u><link="rulebook-first_strike">First Strike</link></u>, or using a weapon with <u><link="rulebook-first_strike">First Strike</link></u>, gains the rules and Characteristic <u><link="modifiers">modifiers</link></u> stated in brackets. For example, a <u><link="model">model</link></u> part with <u><link="rulebook-first_strike">First Strike(+1 Str)</link></u> gains +1 Str in the first round of combat.

Name: Hidden
Description:
The <u><link="model">model</link></u> is not Deployed as normal. Instead, at the start of any Player Turn, the owner can choose a friendly unit containing Rank-and-File <u><link="model">models</link></u>, which satisfy the following:

-   The <u><link="model">model</link></u> with <u><link="hidden">Hidden</link></u> could normally have joined the unit.
-   The <u><link="model">model</link></u> with <u><link="hidden">Hidden</link></u> has an identical Base Size and Height as the Rank-and-File <u><link="model">models</link></u> in the unit.
-   The unit is not <u><link="rulebook-shaken">Shaken</link></u>,  is not a Summoned unit, but it can be <u><link="engaged_in_combat">Engaged in Combat</link></u>.
After choosing an eligible unit, follow these steps:

-   Remove a Rank-and-File <u><link="model">model</link></u>, with the same base size as the <u><link="model">model</link></u> with <u><link="hidden">Hidden</link></u>, from the front rank of the chosen unit as a casualty.
-   Deploy the <u><link="model">model</link></u> with <u><link="hidden">Hidden</link></u> where the <u><link="removed">removed</link></u> <u><link="model">model</link></u> was positioned.
Note: <u><link="attachable_models">Attachable models</link></u> with <u><link="hidden">Hidden</link></u> can still be Deployed using <u><link="hidden">Hidden</link></u> rules

Name: Zeal
Description: An attack with <u><link="rulebook-zeal">Zeal</link></u> must reroll failed <u><link="towound_rolls">to-wound rolls</link></u>.

Name: Repeater Handbow
Description:
Aim X+, Range 12", Shots 2, Str 3, AP 1*, *Accurate, Quick to Fire, Stand and Shoot
*Attacks made at  Long Range have their AP set to 0.

Name: Irresistible Will
Description: When casting a Learned spell, any Dispelling Roll made against the Casting Roll  suffers a -1 modifier.

Name: Daeb Warfare
Description: When a unit containing <u><link="de-daeb_warfare">Daeb Warfare</link></u> is part of a Combined Charge,  its Charge Range rolls gain Maximised. When multiple units containing <u><link="de-daeb_warfare">Daeb Warfare</link></u> are Engaged in the same Combined Combat, each unit gains <u><link="rulebook-first_strike">First Strike</link></u>(<u><link="rulebook-resolute">Resolute(1)</link></u>).

Name: March and Shoot
Description: Performing a <u><link="march_move">March Move</link></u> in the same Player Turn does not prevent shooting with <u><link="attacks">attacks</link></u> or <u><link="model">model</link></u> parts with <u><link="march_and_shoot">March and Shoot</link></u>, but the attack can still suffer -1 to hit for Moving and Shooting.

Name: Repeater Crossbow
Description: Aim X+, Range 18", Shots 2, Str 3, AP 1*, *Attacks made at  Long Range have their AP set to 0.

Name: Afflict
Description:
Units in contact with one or more enemy <u><link="model">models</link></u> with <u><link="rulebook-afflict">Afflict(X)</link></u>, suffer the effects given by X.
A unit can only be affected by one instance of each <u><link="rulebook-afflict">Afflict(X)</link></u>, provided that the X in brackets is identical. If the brackets from two instances of <u><link="rulebook-afflict">Afflict</link></u> are not identical, i.e. different X, then they are considered different rules and the effects from both are applied.

Name: Kraken's Hide
Description: The wearer gains +1 Arm and <u><link="rulebook-strider">Strider(Water Terrain)</link></u>.

Name: Altar of Tila
Description:
: The model’s Charge Speed and Mobility are always 0".
In addition, it gains <u><link="rulebook-channel">Channel (2)</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-emplacement">Emplacement</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-fearless">Fearless</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-solitary">Solitary</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-stubborn">Stubborn</link></u>, and <u><link="rulebook-unstable">Unstable</link></u>.
When another friendly unit within 18" of the model suffers one or more unsaved wounds from an enemy attack, the <u><link="de-altar_of_tila">Altar of Tila</link></u> may cause 3 hits with Str 4, AP 2 and, <u><link="rulebook-unmodifiable">Unmodifiable</link></u> towards the enemy unit that caused the wounds. This effect can only be used once per Phase.

Name: Sweeping Attack
Description:
When a <u><link="model">model</link></u> with <u><link="sweeping_attack">Sweeping Attack</link></u> is within 1" of an unengaged enemy unit during a Move Manoeuvre (even temporarily), the <u><link="model">model’s</link></u> unit may perform a <u><link="sweeping_attack">Sweeping Attack</link></u> against that enemy unit. This can only be used once per friendly Player Turn. Resolve the <u><link="sweeping_attack">Sweeping Attack</link></u> when the Move Manoeuvre is completed.
The attack hits automatically, and counts as a Ranged Attack. Each <u><link="model">model</link></u> in the unit with <u><link="sweeping_attack">Sweeping Attack</link></u> must use its <u><link="sweeping_attack">Sweeping Attack</link></u> against the same enemy unit. The <u><link="sweeping_attack">Sweeping Attack</link></u> hits automatically, causing a number of hits as defined in the brackets (X hits). These hits are resolved with the <u><link="model">model</link></u> part’s Strength, Armour Penetration and <u><link="attack_attributes">Attack Attributes</link></u>, but not <u><link="weapons">Weapons</link></u>.
If values for Strength, Armour Penetration and additional <u><link="attack_attributes">Attack Attributes</link></u> are defined in the bracket (Y), these are used instead. In this case, note that characteristics <u><link="modifiers">modifiers</link></u> and <u><link="attack_attributes">Attack Attributes</link></u> on the <u><link="model">model</link></u> part itself do not affect this attack.

Name: Petrifying Stare
Description: At the model's Agility Step, each enemy unit in contact with the model suffers 2 hits that are set to-wound on 5+, and the hits always have AP 10 and <u><link="rulebook-magical_attacks">Magical Attacks</link></u>.

Name: Elven Finesse
Description: <u><link="model">Model</link></u> parts with this Attack Attribute Attacking with <u><link="great_weapon">Great Weapons</link></u> strike at -1 Agility instead of always at Agility 0.

Name: Temple Acolytes
Description: The Dread Acolyte model part gains <u><link="de-artistry_of_death">Artistry of Death</link></u>, Paired Weapons and Temple.

Name: Harpoon Launcher
Description:
Aim 3+, Range 18", Shots 3, Str 6, AP 3, Accurate, Quick to Fire
Units that suffer one or more hits from this weapon lose <u><link="rulebook-swiftstride">Swiftstride</link></u>, until the start of the Active Player’s next Turn, and cannot gain it in any way

Name: Emplacement
Description:
Units entirely with <u><link="rulebook-emplacement">Emplacement</link></u> cannot Declare Charges, perform <u><link="march_move">March Moves</link></u> or <u><link="pursue_moves">Pursue Moves</link></u> (including Random Movement), or choose the Flee! Charge Reaction. If a unit entirely with <u><link="rulebook-emplacement">Emplacement</link></u> is about to perform a <u><link="flee_move">Flee Move</link></u>, it is instead <u><link="removed">removed</link></u> as a casualty. Name: Spell Selection
Description:
<u><link="model">Models</link></u> that can cast <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> of any kind are called Casters. Casters able to cast Learned <u><link="spells">Spells</link></u> are called Wizards.
If a Caster has a choice between <u><link="spells">spells</link></u>, or knows Learned <u><link="spells">Spells</link></u>, the chosen <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> must be written on the Army List. Casters know different numbers of <u><link="spells">spells</link></u>, and select them as described in their unit entries, except for Wizards. They all follow the same <u><link="general">general</link></u> rules for selecting their Learned <u><link="spells">Spells</link></u>:
Each  of the following Wizard types must choose a Path of Magic to select <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> from. Which Paths it has access to is specified under each Wizard's unit entry. The chosen Path of Magic must be written on the Army List.
Wizards know  different numbers of Learned <u><link="spells">Spells</link></u>, and can choose <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> depending on their type:
-   Wizard Apprentice: 1 spell  that is the Apprentice Spell (#1).
-   <u><link="wizard_adept">Wizard Adept</link></u>: 3 <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> chosen from Apprentice Spell and Adept <u><link="spells">Spells</link></u> (#1 - #4).
-   Wizard Master:  5 <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> chosen from Apprentice Spell,  Adept <u><link="spells">Spells</link></u>, and Master <u><link="spells">Spells</link></u> (#1 - #6).
If either of the following types, then the Wizard does not select a Path of Magic:
-   <u><link="rulebook-wizard_conclave">Wizard Conclave</link></u> (X): X <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> from the list of Learned <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> specified under each unit entry with <u><link="rulebook-wizard_conclave">Wizard Conclave</link></u>.
-   <u><link="protean_magic">Protean Magic</link></u> (X): X Apprentice <u><link="spells">spells</link></u>, chosen from any Path it has access to.
During <u><link="pregame_selections">Pre-game Selections</link></u>, Casters may  swap <u><link="spells">spells</link></u>. See 3.2 <u><link="pregame_selections">Pregame Selections</link></u> for details.
To save time and space on Army List writing, we recommend that the wizard level of a <u><link="model">model</link></u> is followed by the path name with the numbers of the selected <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> in brackets. \
For example, <u><link="wizard_adept">Wizard Adept</link></u>, Alchemy (2, 3, 4).

Name: Shooting Phase
Description:
There are many kinds of shooting used by the armies of the 9th Age, from bows, guns and thrown weapons to arcane devices and grand artillery machines. With the exception of magical spells, the Shooting Phase is your chance to unleash all of your ranged attacks at the foe, thinning their forces without the risks of close melee. But of course the enemy may not make it easy, taking cover behind any battlefield shelter they can find to foil your attempts at a clear shot.
The Shooting Phase consists of the following steps:
1 -     Choose one of your units and perform a Shooting Attack with it.
2 -     Select the target of the attack and which models in the unit will shoot. Each model must have Line of Sight to at least one model in the target unit and be within its effective range.
3 -     Resolve the shooting attack.
4 -     Repeat steps 1 to 3 with a different unit that has not yet performed a Shooting Attack during this phase, if desired.
When all units that can and want to shoot have done so, the Shooting Phase ends.

Name: Armour Saves
Description:
The defender rolls <u><link="armour_saves">Armour Saves</link></u>, by rolling a D6 for each wound, and comparing the result with the <u><link="model">model’s</link></u> Armour Value, reduced by the <u><link="attacks">Attack's</link></u> Armour Penetration.
The modified Armour Value describes the number of sides on a D6, counting down from the highest value, that will result in a successful roll, see tables below. If the Armor Save is successful, the wound is ignored. However, a natural roll of ‘1’ is considered a failure.
Arm - AP    Armour Save Roll
5 or above    2+
4    3+
3    4+
2    5+
1    6+
0    Cannot be passed  

AP 0    AP 1    AP 2    AP 3    AP 4    AP 5    AP 6
Arm 0    N/A    N/A    N/A    N/A    N/A    N/A    N/A
Arm 1    6+    N/A    N/A    N/A    N/A    N/A    N/A
Arm 2    5+    6+    N/A    N/A    N/A    N/A    N/A
Arm 3    4+    5+    6+    N/A    N/A    N/A    N/A
Arm 4    3+    4+    5+    6+    N/A    N/A    N/A
Arm 5    2+    3+    4+    5+    6+    N/A    N/A
Arm 6    2+    2+    3+    4+    5+    6+    N/A  

For example, Armour 3, means that ‘6’, ‘5’, and ‘4’ would be successful Armour Save rolls. If the <u><link="model">model</link></u> is attacked by Armour Penetration 1, its Armour is reduced to Armour 2, which now means that ‘6’ and ‘5’ are successful Armour Save rolls. 
This is equivalent with using the formula below to determine the required roll to negate the wound:
7 - (Defender’s Armor)
+ (Attacker’s Armour Penetration)

Combined Armour
Each <u><link="model">model</link></u> has a base Armour value in its profile, and some <u><link="model">models</link></u> may have additional equipment, rules, or are under the effect of <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> that modify the Armour values. Different sources of Armour can be combined, adding up to the total combined Armour.
For example, a <u><link="model">model</link></u> with a base Armour of 3 that is under the effect of a spell that grants +1 Armour, has a combined Armour of 4. When wounded by an attack with Armour Penetration 1, the Armour Save roll would be ‘4’, ‘5’, or ‘6’ (or 4+).

Behold, a rare and unique quality.
Units, <u><link="attacks">attacks</link></u> and <u><link="spells">spells</link></u> can have key words called <u><link="properties">Properties</link></u> <u><link="rulebook-attached">attached</link></u> to them. <u><link="properties">Properties</link></u> describe the unit’s origin, allegiance, elemental effects of its <u><link="attacks">attacks</link></u>, or other defining attributes. <u><link="properties">Properties</link></u> can always be identified by their names being displayed in grey and italics.
<u><link="properties">Properties</link></u> are rules that do not possess any innate or direct effects. Instead <u><link="properties">properties</link></u> are only used as triggers for other rules. Name: Standard Melee Attacks
Description:
<u><link="standard_melee_attacks">Standard Melee Attacks</link></u>
The most common type of attack in the <u><link="melee_phase">Melee Phase</link></u> is the Standard Melee Attack, which all <u><link="model">models</link></u> can perform provided they have an Attack Value on their profile (see <u><link="characteristic_profiles">Characteristic Profiles</link></u> in the <u><link="definitions_and_terminology">Definitions and Terminology</link></u> chapter). To resolve these <u><link="attacks">attacks</link></u>, roll a number of D6 equal to the Attack Value of the attacking <u><link="model">model</link></u> part. This roll is called a to-hit roll.
Compare the attacking <u><link="model">model</link></u> part's Offensive Skill with the target <u><link="model">model's</link></u> Defensive Skill and consult the table below for the needed <u><link="dice">dice</link></u> roll to score a successful hit. A natural roll of ‘1’ is always a failure, and a natural roll of ‘6’ is always a success. Both tables present the same relation, visualised in different ways.
Offensive Skill -
Defensive Skill    Needed roll to hit
4 or more    2+
1 to 3    3+
-3 to 0    4+

Name: Descent into Sin
Description:
An army from this Supplement Army Book uses a Sin Token pool in order to track the Battlefield’s <u><link="descent_into_sin">Descent into Sin</link></u>. At the start of the game, this pool does not contain any Sin Tokens. During the game, specific events will add Sin Tokens to the pool.
Consult the <u><link="descent_into_sin">Descent into Sin</link></u> Table below to determine the effects of the current number of Sin Tokens in the pool. These effects come into play when both of the following conditions are met:

-   The corresponding threshold has been reached.
-   It is the Legion of Sin Player Turn.
In battles between two armies from this Supplement Army Book, track each pool separately.
\
Effects from different thresholds and pools stack and, unless specifically stated otherwise, affect both armies.
\Add one Sin Token to your pool immediately when one of the following conditions is met:
-   The opponent chooses to apply <u><link="wages_of_sin">Wages of Sin</link></u>.
-   At the start of any Melee Phase, one or more friendly Characters with <u><link="dominion">Dominion</link></u> and/or <u><link="greater_dominion_of_sin">Greater Dominion of Sin</link></u> are in base contact with an enemy unit.
In addition, each Legion of Sin has a unique condition for adding Sin Tokens to their Sin Token pool:
-   <u><link="envy">Envy</link></u>:
Add 1 Sin Token at the end of a phase in which one or more models with <u><link="dominion">Dominion</link></u> of <u><link="envy">Envy</link></u> cause one or more Health Point losses against an Object of <u><link="envy">Envy;</link></u> if one or more units containing <u><link="objects_of_envy">Objects of Envy</link></u> are removed as casualties, add 1 additional Sin Token.
-   Gluttony: Add 2 Sin Tokens at the end of any Melee Phase in which one or more units have been removed as casualties.
-   Greed: Add 1 Sin Token at the end of Siphon the Veil if the Active Player saved 3-5  Veil Tokens;
if 6 Veil Tokens were saved, add 2 Sin Tokens instead.
-   Lust: Add 1 Sin Token at the start of any Melee Phase for each unit that is Engaged with the Flank  Facing of an enemy unit, 
and 2 Sin Tokens for each unit that is Engaged with the Rear Facing of an enemy unit.
-   Pride: Add 1 Sin Token at the start of the Melee Phase for each combat in which one or more friendly single model units are Engaged with at least one enemy unit with more Full Ranks than themselves, up to a maximum of 2.
-    Sloth: Add 1 Sin Token at the end of any Magic Phase in which at least  two non-Attribute Spells were successfully cast; in case of three or more, add 2 Sin Tokens instead.
-    Wrath: Add  1 Sin Token at the end of any Charge Phase in which  two  units declared a Charge;
if three or more units declared a Charge, add 2 Sin Tokens instead.

Description: Successful to-wound rolls of attacks that are Flaming Attacks made against the model must be rerolled. In addition, the model considers all units consisting entirely of models without <u><link="unburnt">Unburnt</link></u> as Insignificant.

Name: Altar of Nabh

The model gains <u><link="rulebook-attached">Attached</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-exclusive">Exclusive (Height 1)</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-frenzy">Frenzy</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-fury">Fury</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-unruly">Unruly</link></u>, and <u><link="rulebook-war_platform">War Platform</link></u>.
Model parts with Elf in friendly units within 12" of the <u><link="de-altar_of_nabh">Altar of Nabh</link></u> gain <u><link="rulebook-fury">Fury</link></u>.

Name: Altar of Yema
Description:
The model gains <u><link="rulebook-attached">Attached</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-exclusive">Exclusive (Height 1)</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-war_platform">War Platform</link></u>, and a single “Attendant” model part gains <u><link="de-petrifying_stare">Petrifying Stare</link></u>.
Whenever a friendly unit within 12" of the <u><link="de-altar_of_yema">Altar of Yema</link></u> initiates any kind of move (see “Definition and Terminology” chapter in the Reference Handbook), the unit gains +1 Mobility and <u><link="rulebook-devastating_charge">Devastating Charge</link></u> (<u><link="rulebook-strider">Strider</link></u>).
Duration: End of Turn.

Name: Warlock Acolytes

The unit gains <u><link="de-irresistible_will">Irresistible Will</link></u> and <u><link="rulebook-wizard_conclave">Wizard Conclave (2)</link></u>.
The Dread Acolyte model parts gains Warlock.
The unit selects its spells from:
   • Ice and Fire (Cosmology)
   • Whispers of the Veil (Evocation)
   • Illusory Paths (Witchcraft)
   • Curse of the Phantom Queen (Hereditary Spell)

Name: Academy Commander

It also gains Great Weapon, Halberd, and Shield.

Name: Cut one off ...

Name: Moithir's Mirror

The bearer gains <u><link="rulebook-aegis">Aegis (5+, against Melee Attacks)</link></u>.
If one or more Melee Attacks are allocated against the bearer, it gains <u><link="rulebook-grind_attack">Grind Attack</link></u>(3 hits, Str 4, AP 2, <u><link="rulebook-magical_attacks">Magical Attacks</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-unmodifiable">Unmodifiable</link></u>), with duration: Round of Combat.

<u><link="rulebook-exclusive">Exclusive (Captain, Silent Assassin)</link></u>. The unit’s maximum size is changed to 15 models for units entirely with Height 1, and to 6 models for units entirely with Height 2.
Rank-and-File model parts with Elf in the bearer’s unit gain <u><link="rulebook-devastating_charge">Devastating Charge(+1 Att)</link></u>.

Name: Eye of the Gorgon
Description:
The bearer’s unit gains Horror.
When Choosing Equipment and Abilities, nominate one Rank-and-File model part, or a model part on the bearer’s model, in the Front Rank of the bearer’s unit; the nominated model part gains <u><link="de-petrifying_stare">Petrifying Stare</link></u>.

Name: Caedhren's Pennon
Description: While the bearer’s unit is part of a Combined Charge, that unit, as well as all other units that are Charging the same target, must reroll failed Charge Range rolls, and gain <u><link="rulebook-devastating_charge">Devastating Charge</link></u>(<u><link="rulebook-hard_target">Hard Target (1)</link></u>).

  •  The Duplication Limits Max. X items/army (i.e. Max. X units/army, Max. X models/army, and ) and Rarity in the unit profiles of certain units entirely with Orc are modified, as indicated by TL X.

Name: Darrmu

Description:
One use only. Duration: One Turn. May be activated at the start of any friendly Player Turn, provided the General is on the Battlefield and not Shaken. Apply the following effects:

  •  If the General is a Goblin Demagogue or a Goblin Witch,  friendly units entirely with Goblin, while not Engaged in Combat, gain Light Troops.
		
  •  If the General is an Orc Warlord or an Orc Shaman, friendly units entirely with Orc have their Charge Range rolls Maximised.

Name: Guile and Fury
Description:
Can be cast in one of two versions:
Augment:
	Cannot be cast by a Goblin.
	The target gains +1 to hit, and its Charge Range, Flee Distance, and Pursuit Distance are increased by 1".

Hex:
	Cannot be cast by an Orc.
The target suffers -1 to hit, and its Charge Range, Flee Distance, and Pursuit Distance are reduced by 1".

  •  Use the Arm that the attacking model would have against the Attack that inflicted the wound (including Conditional Application, modifiers, etc.). If so, the bearer cannot use its own Arm (including any modifiers), if available.		
  •  Use the Special Save that the attacking model would have against the Attack that inflicted the wound (including Conditional Application, modifiers, etc.). If so, the bearer cannot use its own Special Save (including any modifiers), if available.

Name: Incendiary
Description:
Give one Incendiary Marker, with Duration: Permanent,  to the unit. A unit with one or more Incendiary Markers gains Weakness(Flaming Attacks). Remove one Incendiary Marker:			
  •  Immediately when the unit suffers one or more wounds (before saves are performed) from Ranged Attacks with  Flaming Attacks.		
  •  At the end of a Round of Combat in which the unit suffers one or more wounds (before saves are performed) from Melee Attacks with  Flaming Attacks.	
	A Character leaving a unit affected by Incendiary is no longer affected, unless the Character was a single model unit when it gained Incendiary. In that case, the Character keeps those Incendiary Markers.

Name: Airborne Legends
Description: All models with Fly share a common Max. 2 models/army restriction.

Description: The target gains Incendiary. In addition, the target suffers -1 Def and -1 Off, and an additional -1 Def and -1 Off, as long as it has 1 or more Incendiary Markers on it.

Name: Golden Idol of Shamut
Description: If the bearer's model is Height 1 it gains Ghost Step, its Cha is set to 4" and its Mob is set to 6". In addition, the bearer can cast Flaming Swords (Pyromancy) as a Bound Spell(3+).

Name: Tablet of Vezodinezh
Description: When the bearer attempts to cast a Learned Spell using four or more Magic Dice, treat a single rolled ‘1’ or ‘2’ as a natural ‘3’.

Name: Lugar's Dice

Name: Breath of the Brass Bull

The unit may select up to two Manifestations instead of one.

Description:
The  unit can cast the spell stated in brackets as a Bound Spell (4+).
When casting the spell choose one Rank-and-File model to be the Caster.

Name: Wings

Name: Favoured of Envy

Legendary.

The unit gains <u><link="rulebook-solitary">Solitary</link></u> and may select up to two Manifestations instead of one.

Description:
The model’s Height is changed to 5.
In addition, its HP are set to 7, its Charge Speed and Mobility are both set to 7", and it gains <u><link="rulebook-fly">Fly</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-light_troops">Light Troops</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-solitary">Solitary</link></u>, <u><link="rulebook-stomp_attack">Stomp Attack (D6 hits)</link></u>, and <u><link="rulebook-terror">Terror</link></u>.

Name: Favoured of Lust

Legendary.

The unit gains <u><link="rulebook-solitary">Solitary</link></u> and may select up to two Manifestations instead of one.

Description: Each time attacks made by the model kill an enemy model in a Duel, the model gains a +1 Combat Score modifier for the rest of the game.

Name: Elusive
Description: Units consisting entirely of models with Elusive may declare a Flee Charge Reaction despite being Fearless.

Name: Manifestation
Description: During Pre-game Selections, each Exalted Herald must choose two different Manifestations from the list below and apply the effects during the game. The model must select two spells out of those indicated for the chosen Manifestations, Wrath of God (Thaumaturgy), and Hellfire (Hereditary Spell). This replaces the normal rules for Spell Selection connected to being a Wizard Adept.

Name: Writhing Nightmares
Description: Enemy units in contact with one or more models with Writhing Nightmares suffer -1 Dis.

Name: Malodorous Swarm
Description: The unit is never considered to have more than one Proper Rank.

Name: Guiding Manifestations
Description:
Daemonic Manifestations that have options for Guiding Manifestations have two point costs. Use point cost and rules stated with this colour-coding and notation. Guiding versions must be noted on your Army List.
Guiding Manifestations affect both the bearer and all Rank-and-File models in the bearer's unit (as long as the bearer remains in the unit), as if the models themselves had the Daemonic Manifestation. Note that Guiding and non-Guiding Manifestations are considered to be the same Daemonic Manifestation.

Name: Hell Can Wait
Description:
One use only. Duration: One Phase.
May be activated just before the model’s unit rolls a Break Test.
The Break Test is automatically failed, and the HP loss suffered from <u><link="rulebook-supernal">Supernal</link></u> is halved, rounding fractions down.

Name: Chitinous Scales
Description: +2 Arm, to a maximum of 3.

Name: Centipede Legs
Description: +2" Mob.

Name: Unnatural Roots
Description: A unit containing one or more Manifestations of Unnatural Roots gains <u><link="rulebook-resolute">Resolute(1)</link></u>.

Name: Mark of the Eternal Champion
Description:
The unit or model knows (or gains) Spear of Infinity (Hereditary Spell) as an additional spell.
If the unit or model is not a Wizard, it instead gains <u><link="rulebook-wizard_conclave">Wizard Conclave(1)</link></u> that knows Spear of Infinity (Hereditary Spell).

Name: Clinging Ichor
Description: Enemy units in base contact with the bearer lose <u><link="rulebook-devastating_charge">Devastating Charge</link></u>.

Name: Mirrored Scales
Description: Each Melee Attack allocated against the model that rolls a ‘1’ to hit, is instead allocated to the attacking model’s Health Pool with <u><link="rulebook-automatic_hits">Automatic Hits</link></u>.

Name: Dark Hide
Description: At the start of step 3.5 of Battle Setup, "Defender’s Advantage", you may remove units entirely with this Manifestation from the Battlefield and Deploy them again elsewhere, following the general Deployment restrictions.

Name: Hammer Hand

Name: Weapons
Description:
Weapons is a subcategory of Model Rules. Similar to Attack Attributes, Weapons can only be used by the model part that has the rule.

	There are two  types of weapons:
	
		
  •  Melee Weapon: A model part can only use a single Melee Weapon simultaneously, and only when Engaged in combat. If the model is equipped with multiple Melee Weapons, choose which one to use in the First Round of Combat, in this priority order:
		
		
  •  An enchanted weapon
		
  •  Any weapon that is neither a Hand Weapon, nor Innate Weapons
		
  •  A Hand Weapon
		
  •  Innate Weapons
		

		This choice is then kept until the model is no longer Engaged in Combat. Melee Weapons are used with the model part’s Standard Melee Attacks.
				
			
				
  •  Modifiers to Offensive Characteristics and Attack Attributes are applied only to the model part’s Standard Melee Attacks.
				
  •  Modifiers to Global or Defensive Characteristics (Mob, Cha, Cou, Def, HP, Res, or Arm), and Model Rules that are not Attack Attributes, are applied to the model or model part (see rules for Character Mounts for details when and how Characteristics of mounts are affected) at all times except while using a different Melee Weapon.
				
  •  Variable bonuses, such as those based on a dice roll, are determined at the start of the Agility Step in which the weapon is used.
			

		
		
  •  Shooting Weapon: Shooting Weapons are used for making Shooting Attacks. Each model part can only use one Shooting Weapon per phase. A Shooting Weapon typically has an Aim Value, shown in brackets after the name of the weapon. The rules for the Shooting Weapon will define the weapon’s maximum Range, the number of Shots fired, and the Strength, Armour Penetration, and potentially Attack Attributes applied to its attacks.

In addition, when a model with this Attack Attribute is removed as a casualty during the Melee Phase due to an enemy Melee Attack, it must immediately, before removal, perform a single Close Combat Attack with the following rules and restrictions:			
  •  The attack is always resolved with Strength 5 and Armour Penetration 2.		
  •  The owner must choose one of the following options:					
  •  The attack is allocated towards the model that caused the casualty.			
  •  The attack is allocated towards a Rank-and-File model in that model's unit.

  •  Up to 3 Runic Artefacts can be applied to a model.		
  •  Each combination of Runic Artefacts is  Legendary.		
  •  Multiple instances of the same Runic Artefacts are added together, unless specifically mentioned otherwise.		
  •  When noting Runes on the Army List, use the following format: Runic Artefact (rune A, rune B, rune C).

Description:
The unit gains Solitary. When the unit fails a Break Test, replace each model of the unit with a Wretched One model, after taking Panic Tests:
  •  The unit entirely with Damnation is considered destroyed and its models are considered to be removed as casualties.
  •  Each Wretched One model is placed in the same position and facing the same direction as the replaced model, even if the replaced model was in contact with an enemy unit. In this case, the Wretched One model is placed in contact with the enemy unit too.
  •  The Wretched One models form a new unit.
  •  The Wretched One unit follows the rules for Summoned Units, except that it ignores the Unit Spacing rule when placed on the Battlefield.
  •  The Wretched One unit cannot perform any Combat Reforms during that Round of Combat, however the enemy units can do so as normal.
  •  Note that the following Round of Combat is not considered the First Round of Combat for the Wretched One unit nor the enemy units it is Engaged with.

In addition, for each natural to-hit roll of ‘1’ with a Close Combat Attack made by the bearer's unit, the bearer's unit suffers 1 hit with Strength 3 and Armour Penetration 0 in the same Initiative Step. This is considered a Special Attack.

Name: Martyr's Shroud
Description: models with Cult of Errahman in the bearer's unit gain Regeneration(6+).

Name: Plague Prophet's Blessing
Description: The wearer gains +1 Health Point and Regeneration(5+). Successful to-hit rolls with Close Combat Attacks against the wearer must be rerolled.

Name: Orator’s Toga
Description: The bearer gains Stand Behind and cannot issue Duels.

Name: Putrid Pamphlet
Description: The bearer’s unit must reroll natural to-hit rolls of ‘1’.

Name: Crucible of Contagion
Description: The bearer’s model gains +1 Health Point, and enemy units in base contact with the bearer’s model suffer -1 Resilience.

Name: Plague Disciples
Description: The unit replaces its Bloodpox Blades with Plague Flail.

Name: Underworld Beast
Description: The model gains Random Movement(3D6") and its Attack Value is set to 4D3. It loses the Pitmaster model part, and its base size is changed to 60×100 mm.

Name: Corsair Ravagers
Description:
- Universal Rule

The model gains Extra Support(2), Hard Target(1), Light Troops and Skirmisher. In addition, enemy models that are not immune to the effects of  in units in base contact with one or more models with Corsair Ravagers suffer -1 Discipline.

	The model gains Extra Support(2), Hard Target(1), Light Troops and Skirmisher. In addition, enemy models that are not immune to the effects of  in units in base contact with one or more models with Corsair Ravagers suffer -1 Discipline.

Name: Obsidian Admiral
Description:
- Universal Rule

The model part gains +2 Attack Value and its Special Item allowance is increased by 100 pts. In addition, the army may modify the roll for choosing Deployment Zones by -1.

	The model part gains +2 Attack Value and its Special Item allowance is increased by 100 pts. In addition, the army may modify the roll for choosing Deployment Zones by -1.

Name: Storm Singer
Description:
- Universal Rule

The model can select its spells from all the Learned Spells of its chosen Path and the Hereditary Spell. This rule overrides the Spell Selection rules connected to being a Wizard Adept.

	The model can select its spells from all the Learned Spells of its chosen Path and the Hereditary Spell. This rule overrides the Spell Selection rules connected to being a Wizard Adept.

Name: Repeater Handbow[X]
Description: Range 12", Shots X, Str 3, AP 0, Accurate, Quick to Fire. 	When shooting from Short Range, the weapon gains +1 Armour Penetration.

Name: Shrouded by Mist
Description:
Apply the following rules during the first Game Turn:
	
		
  •  For Shooting Attacks made against units that are more than 12" away, all units (friend and foe) are considered to be in Soft Cover.
		
  •  Charge Range rolls made against units that are more than 12" away are subject to Minimised Roll unless more than half of the Charging unit’s models have Coastal Predator.

Name: Tempest of the Storm Witch
Description: The target may immediately perform a 12" Magical Move and loses Scoring. {In addition, the target gains Coastal Predator.}

Name: Lacerating Touch
Description: Attacks made with this weapon gain +2 Armour Penetration. While using this weapon, the wielder gains +2 Attack Value and .

Name: Hurricane's Fury
Description: Range 18", Shots 2D6. Shooting Attacks of units that are hit by one or more attacks made with this weapon suffer -1 to hit until the end of the next Player Turn.

Name: Veil of Harag
Description: The bearer can cast Tempest of the Storm Witch (Hereditary Spell) as a Bound Spell with Power Level (4/8).

Name: Storm Cloak
Description: The bearer gains Magic Resistance(2) and Hard Target(1).

Name: Chest of Enveloping Fog
Description: One use only. The owner may activate this Artefact at the end of any friendly Movement Phase and place a Water Terrain Feature in contact with the bearer and at least 1" away from any enemy units and other Terrain Features. The Water Terrain must fit within a circle with a diameter of 6".

Name: Black Flag
Description: The bearer's unit gains Fear, and while in base contact with the bearer's unit, enemy units gain Maximised (Fear Tests). In addition, friendly units Engaged in the same Combat as the bearer's unit must reroll natural to-wound rolls of  '1'.

Name: Banner of Tides
Description: The bearer’s unit gains Feigned Flight.

Name: Horde Thresher
Description:
Changes to the model's profile:
	
		
  •  Its base size is changed to 100×100mm.
		
  •  Its Health Points are set to 6.
		
  •  It gains 1 additional Tiller.
		
  •  It gains 1 additional Draft Beast.
		
  •  It gains Colossal Stature.
		
  •  The Chassis gains Impact Hits(3D3).

Name: Legion Thresher
Description:
Changes to the model's profile:
	
		
  •  Its base size is changed to 100×150mm.
		
  •  Its Health Points are set to 8.
		
  •  It gains 2 additional Tillers.
		
  •  It gains 2 additional Draft Beasts.
		
  •  It gains Colossal Stature.
		
  •  The Chassis gains Impact Hits(4D3).

Name: Master of Ritual
Description: The model gains +1 Discipline, Daemonic Summon, Scout, and Commanding Presence(18").

Name: Hideout
Description:
The Cultists army gains +6 to the roll for choosing the Deployment Zone.
	Immediately after determining who deploys first (after step 1 of the Deployment Phase Sequence), the owner must place a single Ruins Terrain Feature with its centre in the friendly Deployment Zone and not in contact with any other Terrain Feature except Open Terrain.
	This Terrain Feature may not be larger than 8" in length and 8" in width.

Name: Eldritch Tome
Description:
Units with Champion only.

	The unit gains Wizard Conclave that knows only Spear of Infinity (Hereditary Spell).

Name: Abyssal Conduit
Description: One model in the unit that is not a Champion or Musician becomes a Standard Bearer with Channel (1) and Daemonic Summon.

Name: Infiltrators
Description: The model gains Light Troops, Scout, and Skirmisher and loses Scoring.

Name: Firestarter
Description: The Standard Bearer can cast the spell stated in brackets as a Bound Spell with Power Level (5/8).

Name: Talon Scythes
Description: Attacks made with Talon Scythes ignore Parry and, if allocated towards Standard or Large Infantry, gain a +1 to-hit modifier.

Name: Dark Conclave
Description:
Spells cast by the model gain +3" range for each additional friendly Wizard within 12" of the Caster. This bonus can never increase the combined modifier beyond +9", however other sources may.
The model must select 2 spells from: Spear of Infinity (Hereditary Spell), The Grave Calls (Occultism), and Smite the Unbeliever (Thaumaturgy) during Spell Selection. This overrides the normal Spell Selection rules connected to being a Wizard Adept.
When performing a Daemonic Summon with the model, divide the chosen unit's Point Cost by 300 (instead of 200), rounding fractions up, for determining the number of discarded Veil Tokens.

Name: Grand Council
Description:
The model's Health Points and Attack Value are set to 8, and its base size is changed to 120 mm round.
	The model can also select Wrath of God (Thaumaturgy) as one of its 2 spells.

Name: Doomsday Colossus
Description: The model's Health Points are set to 8, and its base size is changed to 75×100 mm. The roll for the number of hits from its Stomp Attacks is subject to Maximised Roll.

Name: Apostate Automaton
Description: The model gains +1 Resilience, Crush Attack, and its Armour is set to 3.

Name: Heretic Golem
Description: The model gains +1 Strength and +1 Armour Penetration.

Name: Wicker Man
Description: The model gains Flammable, Flaming Attacks, and Grind Attack(3D3). These Grind Attacks are resolved with Strength 4, Armour Penetration 0, and Flaming Attacks.

Name: Dark Fire
Description: Armour Save rolls of ‘1’, ‘2’, ‘3’, and ‘4’ are always considered failed when saving wounds caused by Dark Fire.

Name: Hellish Growl
Description: At the start of each Round of Combat, enemy units in base contact with one or more models with Hellish Growl must take a Discipline Test with a -1 modifier.	Failed to-wound rolls from attacks made by the model against units that fail this test must be rerolled. The effect lasts until the end of the Round of Combat.

Name: Colossal Stature
Description: The model counts as Gigantic for the purpose of determining the number of Full Ranks.

Name: Mountain Breaker
Description: In the Charge Phase, the model gains Maximised(Charge Range) for Charges against units consisting entirely of models with Towering Presence. In addition, the model's Impact Hits gain Multiple Wounds(D3, against ).

Name: Spell Craving
Description: The model can perform up to 3 Supporting Attacks. When determining Combat Score, a side with at least one model with Spell Craving Engaged in Combat adds +X to its side's Combat Score, where X is the number of non-Bound non-Attribute Spells known by enemy Wizards in units in base contact with it (note that multiple instances of the same spell count as 1 each).

Name: Veil Stalker
Description:
The model follows the rules for Ambush with the following exceptions:
When the unit arrives, the owner may choose to place it within 6" of an enemy model with Channel (instead of entering the Battlefield from the Table Edge). If so, it cannot perform any Advance Moves this Movement Phase (note that this does not prevent the unit from performing a Reform).

Name: Tightening Grasp
Description: The model gains Grind Attack(X), and can make Grind Attack as Supporting Attacks, ignoring the maximum number of Supporting Attacks. When the model is not Engaged in Combat, X is set to 1.	At the start of each Round of Combat other than the First Round of Combat, if the model is Engaged, X is increased by +1 (e.g. Grind Attack(1) becomes Grind Attack(2)).

Name: Elusive
Description: Units composed entirely of models with Elusive may declare a Flee Charge Reaction despite being Fearless.

Name: Falling Star
Description:
The model's Offensive Skill and Defensive Skill are set to twice the model's current number of Health Points.
The model counts as a Character for the purpose of issuing, accepting, and refusing Duels. When the model fights a Duel during a Round of Combat, it gains Stubborn until the end of the Round of Combat.

Name: Aether Battery
Description: Before rolling for the number of Shots, the owner may choose to discard 1--3 Veil Tokens from their Veil Token pool. If so, the number of Shots is increased by +3 per discarded Veil Token.

Name: Manifestation
Description: During Pre-game Selections, each Exalted Herald must choose two different Manifestations from the list below and apply the effects during the game. The model must select two spells out of those indicated for the chosen Manifestations, Wrath of God (Thaumaturgy), and Hellfire (Hereditary Spell). This replaces the normal rules for Spell Selection connected to being a Wizard Adept.

Name: Writhing Nightmares
Description: Enemy units in base contact with one or more models with Writhing Nightmares suffer -1 Discipline.

Name: Morphlings
Description: During Spell Selection, each unit of Veil Serpents must choose a Manifestation from the list below and apply the effects during the game.

Name: Acid Blood
Description: For each Regeneration Save the model fails against Melee Attacks, the model immediately inflicts 1 hit with Toxic Attacks against the model that caused the wound, before any casualties are removed, distributed onto the model's Health Pool.

Name: Living Shield
Description: The model gains Parry.

Name: Chitinous Scales
Description: The model gains +2 Armour, to a maximum of 3.

Name: Centipede Legs
Description: The model gains +2" March Rate.

Name: Unnatural Roots
Description: A side with one or more models with Unnatural Roots Engaged in Combat when Combat Scores are calculated adds +1 to its Combat Score.

Name: Mark of the Eternal Champion
Description: If the bearer is not a Wizard, it becomes a Wizard Apprentice that does not select spells as normal but always knows Spear of Infinity (Hereditary Spell). If the bearer is already a Wizard, it knows Spear of Infinity in addition to its other spells and cannot select it during Spell Selection.

Name: Mirrored Scales
Description: Each Close Combat Attack allocated towards the model for which a natural ‘1’ is rolled to hit is distributed onto the attacking model's Health Pool.

Name: Dark Hide
Description: The model gains Scout with the following exception: it must be deployed fully inside the owner's Deployment Zone, and the owner must have deployed at least one unit normally.

Name: Hammer Hand
Description: The model gains +1 Attack Value.

Name: Iron Husk
Description: The model's Resilience is set to 6.

Name: Brimstone Secretions
Description: The model gains Immune (Divine Attacks).

Name: Kaleidoscopic Flesh
Description: The model gains Hard Target(1).

Name: Venom Sacs
Description: The model gains Poison Attacks. If the model's Close Combat Attacks already were Poison Attacks from another source than this Manifestation, they wound automatically on a successful natural to-hit roll of '5' or '6', unless the target has Immune (Poison Attacks).

Name: Greenfire Eyes
Description: Units containing one or more models with Greenfire Eyes must reroll any natural rolls of ‘1’ when rolling for Charge Range and Pursuit Distance.

Name: Piercing Spike
Description: Close Combat Attacks made by the model gain +1 Armour Penetration.

Name: Unhinging Jaw
Description: Failed to-wound rolls from Close Combat Attacks against Large or Gigantic models made by the model must be rerolled.

Name: Digestive Vomit
Description: The first time the model is on the winning side of a combat, it gains +1 Strength and +1 Armour Penetration until the end of the game.

Name: Broodmother
Description: For each Health Point loss the model causes with Close Combat Attacks against enemy units, roll a D6 at the end of the Initiative Step. For each rolled 6+, the model's Health Pool Raises 1 Health Point.

Name: Divining Snout
Description: The model gains Devastating Charge(+2" Adv) for Charges against units that contain at least one Special Item. The effects only apply if all models in the unit are affected by Divining Snout.

Name: Smothering Coils
Description: The model gains +1 to-wound with Close Combat Attacks against models with Scoring.

Name: Segmented Shell
Description: When the model suffers a wound from an attack with Multiple Wounds(X), reduce X by 1, to a minimum of 1.

Name: Hot Blood
Description: The model gains Devastating Charge(+2 Agi).

Name: Mesmerising Plumage
Description: Enemy units in base contact with one or more models with this Manifestation suffer -1 Offensive Skill and -1 Defensive Skill.

Name: Roaming Hands
Description: While the unit is Engaged with an enemy unit's Flank or Rear Facing, the model gains +1 Strength and +1 Armour Penetration.

Name: Horns of Hubris
Description: The model gains Vanguard(6"").

Name: Stiff Upper Lip
Description: Units with at least one model with this Manifestation gain Minimised(Discipline Tests).

Name: Bronze Backbone
Description: The model gains Hatred.

Name: Aura of Despair
Description: The model gains Accurate.

Name: Chilling Yawn
Description: Enemy units in base contact with one or more models with this Manifestation suffer -2 Agility.

Name: Sorcerous Antennae
Description: At the start of Siphon the Veil in each of your Magic Phases, choose a single model part in each unit with one or more instances of this Manifestation. The chosen model part gains Channel (1) until the end of the Magic Phase.

Name: Incendiary Ichor
Description: The model gains Aegis(3+, against Flaming Attacks). All Melee Attacks (including Special Attacks) and Shooting Attacks made by the model with Incendiary Ichor become Flaming Attacks. The model automatically fails all Regeneration Saves.

Name: Whipcrack Tail
Description: The model gains .

Name: Red Haze
Description: The model's Close Combat Attacks gain +1 Strength and +1 Armour Penetration, but each of its Close Combat Attacks with a natural to-hit roll of ‘1’ is distributed onto the attacking model's Health Pool.

Name: Pledged to Darkness
Description:
Models with Pledged to Darkness gain Exclusive(Pledged to Darkness). While joined by one or more Characters, Rank-and-File models with Pledged to Darkness gain Fearless.	Certain units with Pledged to Darkness can choose one of the following 4 Species Archetypes, which give the models the changes stated below. If any unit chooses one of these Species Archetypes, all units capable of doing so must choose the same Species Archetype.										

Wayward Children
	
  •  +1" Cha
	
  •  +2" Mob
	
  •  +1 Agility
		

Fallen Heroes
	
  •  Base : 25×25mm
	
  •  Resilience set to 4
	
  •  -1 Agi
		

The Dishonoured
	
  •  -1" Cha
	
  •  Mobility set to at least 9"*
	
  •  Resilience set to 4
	
  •  -1 Agi
		

Kinslayers
	
  •  Base : 25×25mm
	
  •  +1 Off
	
  •  +1 Def
							
	*The March Rate of Daemon Symbiotes and Possessed is set to at least 12" instead.

Name: Sacrificial Offerings
Description: Immediately before performing a Casting Attempt with a Wizard in a unit containing one or more models with Sacrificial Offerings, you may inflict 1 hit against that unit. This hit wounds automatically with no saves of any kind allowed. If a Health Point loss was caused against a model with Sacrificial Offerings, the Casting Attempt gains a +1 Casting Modifier. Each unit can be affected by Sacrificial Offerings only once per Magic Phase.

Name: Daemonic Summon
Description:
At the end of step 3 of the owner's Magic Phase (Siphon the Veil), before Veil Token Limits are applied, each non-Fleeing model with Daemonic Summon may perform a single Daemonic Summon:
	
	
  •  Choose a unit from the Summoned Daemons Army Category on your Army List.
	
  •  Discard a number of Veil Tokens from your Veil Token pool corresponding to the chosen unit's Point Cost divided by 200, rounding fractions up. In the first Game Turn, if the owner has the first Player Turn, a maximum of 2 Veil Tokens may be discarded, and if the owner has the second Player Turn, a maximum of 4 Veil Tokens may be discarded. In all other Game Turns, a maximum of 6 Veil Tokens may be discarded per Player Turn.
	
  •  The chosen unit is deployed with Special Ambush (within 12" of the model that performed the Daemonic Summon). Contrary to the general rules for Special Ambush (X), the unit does not count as having performed a March Move for the purpose of shooting.

Name: Smother
Description: If the attack is allocated towards a model that has the same Height as the attacker, it gains +1 to hit and +1 to wound.

Name: Spear of Infinity
Description:
The target suffers 1 hit with Strength 2 [5], Armour Penetration 2, Area Attack(1×5), and [Multiple Wounds (2)].
The hits from Spear of Infinity gain +1 Strength for each other non-Attribute Spell successfully cast in this Magic Phase (including other instances of Spear of Infinity).

Name: Lifeforce Talisman
Description: Whenever the bearer Miscasts, the owner may choose to inflict D3 hits on the bearer's unit. These hits wound automatically with no saves of any kind allowed. If so, the owner may choose to apply a +1 or a -1 Miscast Modifier.

Name: Ledger of Souls
Description: Immediately before removing a friendly model without Insignificant in a unit within 9" of the bearer's model due to enemy attacks, you gain one Veil Token for each Health Point that model had the first time it entered the Battlefield.

Name: Crown of Hubris
Description: At the start of any friendly Magic Phase, the bearer may choose to inflict 3 hits on its unit that wound automatically with no saves of any kind allowed. If so, the owner gains 3 additional Veil Tokens.

Name: Scurrying Veil
Description:
The bearer's March Rate is set to 20".
	In addition, the bearer's model ignores friendly units when moving in the Charge and Movement Phase, but must follow the Unit Spacing rule at the end of the move.

Name: Gem of Faith's Tithe
Description: Whenever the bearer attempts to cast a spell, the owner may choose a friendly Champion with Pledged to Darkness within 12". If so, use the position of the Champion when drawing Line of Sight and measuring range. For Direct spells, also use the Champion's Front Arc. The owner must use all of these or none at all.

Name: Fiendish Snares
Description: Immediately after Deployment Zones are chosen, the owner nominates a Terrain Feature other than Impassable Terrain or Open Terrain with its centre in their half of the Battlefield. The chosen Terrain Feature becomes Dangerous Terrain (2).

Name: Lugar's Dice
Description: A single model part of the bearer's model can reroll a single failed to-hit, to-wound, or Armour Save roll per Player Turn. Crush Attacks are not affected.

Name: Army Specific Rules
Description: Aegis	Unit profiles in this Army Book contain an additional Characteristic, which corresponds to the units' Aegis Saves, shortened Aeg. This Characteristic is treated as if the unit has the Personal Protection Aegis(X+) written on its profile, where X is the Aeg Characteristic value. Not having an Aeg value does not prevent a unit from being the target of an Aegis modifier.

Name: Daemonic Manifestations
Description:
Cultists armies possess an additional version of Magic Items called Daemonic Manifestations. They follow the rules for Magic Items, with the exception that they are not Legendary and that models cannot be affected by more than one instance of each Manifestation, unless specifically stated otherwise.

Name: Exalted of Envy
Description:
The model gains  +1 Health Point. The model may perform Make Way moves even when it is in base contact with an enemy model.
	The unit entry's Duplication Limit is changed to 0-2 units/army, and the General of an army with one or more models with Exalted of Envy must take Exalted of Envy.

Name: Exalted of Gluttony
Description: The model gains Maximised (Stomp Attacks), One of a Kind, and +1 Health Point.	In addition, replace the rules of Devour with (changes from original version in bold):	For each Health Point loss the model causes with Close Combat Attacks against enemy units, roll a D6 at the end of the Initiative Step. For each rolled 4+, the model gains +1 Health Point. When the model has 20 Health Points or more, all units within 12" immediately suffer 2D6 hits with Toxic Attacks, and the model is removed as a casualty.

Name: Exalted of Lust
Description: The model gains One of a Kind, +1 Health Point, Vanguard, and Aegis(+1, against Ranged Attacks).

Name: Exalted of Greed
Description: The model gains One of a Kind and +1 Health Point. In addition, all Weapon Enchantments are ignored for as long as their bearers remain in base contact with the model.

Name: Exalted of Pride
Description: The model gains One of a Kind and +1 Health Point. The rolls for determining the model's Attack Value and Offensive Skill are subject to Maximised Roll.

Name: Exalted of Sloth
Description: The model gains One of a Kind and +1 Health Point. In addition, instead of selecting spells, the model knows all spells from its chosen Path. A single Learned Spell may be exchanged for the Hereditary Spell during Spell Selection.

Name: Exalted of Wrath
Description: The model gains One of a Kind and +1 Health Point.  In addition, whenever the model suffers one or more Health Point losses from a Close Combat Attack, it must reroll failed to hit rolls until the end of the Player Turn.

For the Harbinger of each Legion of Sin, please refer to the Harbinger of Father Chaos unit entry.	
  •  The options given for each unit entry in this Supplement Army Book replace any options given for the corresponding unit entry in the DL Army Book.	
  •  The Harbinger of each Legion of Sin automatically gains a new Model Rule, and the other Characters gain new optional Model Rules. These Model Rules will be specified in the corresponding unit entry in this Supplement Army Book.	
  •  Characters cannot take Greater Dominion. Instead, the General must take Greater Dominion of Sin if available (see the Army Model Rules section and the corresponding unit entries).

Name: Weapon Enchantments
Description:
Weapon Enchantments are upgrades that enhance weapons. A weapon on which a Weapon Enchantment is applied becomes an Enchanted Weapon. The Army List must indicate which weapon that the model is equipped with is an Enchanted Weapon. Reminder: models are equipped with a Hand Weapon by default. Each Weapon Enchantment can only enchant particular weapon types (e.g. Great Weapon) or a category of weapons (e.g. Melee Weapon).

The following rules apply to all Enchanted Weapons, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  •  If a model is equipped with an Enchanted Weapon it must use it in Combat whenever possible.

  •  All attacks made with the Enchanted Weapon gain Magical Attacks.

  •  The Enchanted Weapon follows the rules for both its original weapon type and the Weapon Enchantment.

  •  See the rules for weapons (Model Rules) for details on when to apply modifiers and additional rules.

Name: Armour Enchantments
Description:
These upgrades enchant pieces of armour carried by a model, and can in general be taken by any model. That model is then considered as wearing an Enchanted Armour.

If an Armour Enchantment is restricted to models with a minimum Arm value, for this purpose only consider the model's part unmodified base Arm value (excluding mounts), the number written on the profile in the Army Book.

The following rules apply to all Armour Enchantments, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  •  Characteristics modifiers, Model Rules, and all other rules associated with Armour Enchantments are generally only applied to the model part wearing the Enchanted Armour, and do not affect other model parts such as mounts. This includes modifiers to Global and Defensive Characteristics. However, note that certain Model Rules, particularly Model Rules that are neither an Attack Attribute nor a weapon, are always applied to the combined model (and not only to individual model parts).

For example the Basalt Infusion provides +1 Arm and Aegis. +1 Arm is a Characteristic modifier and is only applied to the Character wearing the Enchanted Armour. If this Character rides a mount that has its own Armour Value, the extra Arm from Basalt Infusion has no effect on the combined model. However, Aegis is a Global Model Rule, which means it is not applied to an individual model part, but to the whole combined model.

Name: Shield Enchantments
Description:
Shield Enchantments are upgrades made to Shields. An Enchanted Shield follows the rules for both the original Shield and the Shield Enchantment.

The following rules apply to all Shield Enchantments, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  •  The effect of a Shield Enchantment applies only when the bearer of the Enchanted Shield actually uses the Shield (Remember that a model part cannot use a Shield to protect against Melee Attacks when it is using a Two-Handed weapon in combat).

  •  Characteristic modifiers, Model Rules, and all other rules associated with Shield Enchantments follow the same rules as for Armour Enchantments.

Name: Potions and Scrolls
Description:
Potions and Scrolls are Magic Items that provide temporary effects when consumed by a model.

The following rules apply to all Potions and Scrolls, unless specifically mentioned otherwise:

  •  All Potions and Scrolls are One Use Only.

  •  Potions and Scrolls can be activated at the start of any Phase or when Choosing Equipment and Abilities in the Melee Phase.

  •  Effects last until the end of the Player Turn.

  •  Rules for Potions and Scrolls, including Characteristic modifiers and Attack Attributes, are only applied to the model part taking the Magic Item, and do not affect other model parts such as mounts.

Name: Area Attack
Description:
Before making a Shooting Attack with Area Attack, determine the attack's Target Facing hits using the same rules as for Cover.

If the attack hits in the Front or Rear: Select up to Y different ranks of the target. If the attack hits in the Flank: Select up to Y different files of the target. For each rank or file chosen this way, the unit takes X hits, up to a maximum equal to the number of models in that rank or file. An Area Attack can not cause more hits than the total models in the unit, and no single model can suffer more than one hit from each Area Attack. Remember that attacks multiplied into several hits are allocated after establishing how many its are scored (i.e. after the attack has hit).

Figure figure/areaattack illustrates examples of different variations of Area Attack.

Examples of Area Attacks.	Units A to D are hit by an Area Attack (33) from an attacker Located in their Front Arc.\	A: There are 3 ranks with more than 3 models. Number of hits: 3 + 3 + 3 = 9.\	B: The first rank has more than 3 models, but the second rank only has 2 models. There is no third rank. Number of hits: 3 + 2 = 5.\	C: Since there is only a single model, there will always only be a single rank with a single model. Number of hits: 1.\	D: The first and second rank have 3 models. There is no third rank. Number of hits: 3 + 3 = 6.\	Units E and F are hit by an Area Attack (14).\	E: The attacker Located in its Front Arc. The first and second rank have more than 1 model. There is no third or fourth rank. Number of hits: 1 + 1 = 2.\	F: The attacker Located in its Flank Arc. There are more than 4 files with 1 or more models. Number of hits: 1 + 1 +1 +1 = 4.

If Str or AP is given directly, set the Str or AP to that value. For example, Direct Hit (Str 10, AP 6) means one hit has its Str set to 10 and its AP set to 6.

Name: Psychic Attacks
Description: When rolling to wound with this attack, replace the target’s Res with its Dis.

Name: Unmodifiable
Description: Attack Attributes with this special rule are never affected by other rules that affect the model part with the Attack Attribute unless explicitly stated otherwise.

Name: Standard Melee Attacks
Description:
Standard Melee Attacks

The most common type of attack in the Melee Phase is the Standard Melee Attack, which all models can perform provided they have an Attack Value on their profile (see Characteristic Profiles in the Definitions and Terminology chapter). To resolve these attacks, roll a number of D6 equal to the Attack Value of the attacking model part. This roll is called a to-hit roll.

Compare the attacking model part's Offensive Skill with the target model's Defensive Skill and consult the table below for the needed dice roll to score a successful hit. A natural roll of ‘1’ is always a failure, and a natural roll of ‘6’ is always a success. Both tables present the same relation, visualised in different ways.

      Offensive Skill -
Defensive Skill    Needed roll to hit
        4 or more    2+
        1 to 3    3+
        -3 to 0    4+
        -4 or less    5+  

Once you have determined the number of hits, follow the Attack Sequence, using the Strength, Armour Penetration, and on the profile of the attacking model part, potentially modified by things like Weapon, Spells and Model Rules.

Non-Standard Melee Attacks
Attacks that do not fall under the category of Standard Melee Attacks, have their own specific rules for determining the number of hits, as well as the Strength, Armour Penetration, and additional rules to use.

Description: Model Rule

Name: Standard Bearer
Description: Standard Bearer is a unit-wide upgrade, normally represented by the presence of a model carrying the unit standard, icon, military insignia, totem, or other similar symbol. A unit containing a Standard Bearer adds +1 to the Combat Score of its side.

Name: Duplicate Model Rules
Description: Most Model Rules are not cumulative. This means that if a model gains the same rule multiple times, the effects do not stack or provide extra benefits. This includes Model Rules with different keywords attached (such as Multiple Wounds(against Height 2) and Multiple Wounds(against Height 3)), which are considered to be the same Model Rule and thus both instances cannot be applied simultaneously. In such cases, the owner may choose which instance of the Model Rule to use at any point in time.

Name: Model Rules and Units
Description:
Even though Model Rules are given to individual models, there are some Model Rules that function on unit level, such as dictating how entire units can move or operate. Model Rules differentiate between the following cases:
	
	
  •  Units entirely with X: Whenever a Model Rule or Property is referred to as units entirely with the rule, this means units where every single model in it has Rule X or Property X.
	
  •  Units containing X: Whenever a Model Rule is referred to as units containing the rule, this means units where at least one model in it has Rule X or Property X.	
	
  •  Units not containing X: Whenever a Model Rule is referred to as units not containing the rule, this means units where no single model in it has Rule X or Property X.

Name: Attack Attributes
Description:
Attack attributes is a subcategory of Model Rules. While most Model Rules apply to the entire model, including all model parts on the same base, Attack Attributes are the exception, and only affect individual model parts, or even individual attacks. 	Attack Attributes by default only affect Melee Attacks.	
		Attack Attributes for models are therefore written under the Offensive Characteristics part of the model entry, and thus only affect the specific model part it’s listed under. However that if an Attack Attribute is given to a unit (e.g. as a result of a spell), it applies to every model part in that unit, and if given to a model, it applies to all parts of that model.
	In addition to being given to a model part, Attack Attributes can also be given to a weapon, a spell, or an attack. Such Attack Attributes only affect attacks made with those specific sources. They wil not affect other attacks made by the same model part unless given specifically to a weapon, a spell or attack.

Name: Weapons
Description:
Weapons is a subcategory of Model Rules. Similar to Attack Attributes, Weapons can only be used by the model part that has the rule.

	There are two  types of weapons:
	
		
  •  Melee Weapon: A model part can only use a single Melee Weapon simultaneously, and only when Engaged in combat. If the model is equipped with multiple Melee Weapons, choose which one to use in the First Round of Combat, in this priority order:
		
		
  •  An enchanted weapon
		
  •  Any weapon that is neither a Hand Weapon, nor Innate Weapons
		
  •  A Hand Weapon
		
  •  Innate Weapons
		

		This choice is then kept until the model is no longer Engaged in Combat. Melee Weapons are used with the model part’s Standard Melee Attacks.
				
			
				
  •  Modifiers to Offensive Characteristics and Attack Attributes are applied only to the model part’s Standard Melee Attacks.
				
  •  Modifiers to Global or Defensive Characteristics (Mob, Cha, Cou, Def, HP, Res, or Arm), and Model Rules that are not Attack Attributes, are applied to the model or model part (see rules for Character Mounts for details when and how Characteristics of mounts are affected) at all times except while using a different Melee Weapon.
				
  •  Variable bonuses, such as those based on a dice roll, are determined at the start of the Agility Step in which the weapon is used.
			

		
		
  •  Shooting Weapon: Shooting Weapons are used for making Shooting Attacks. Each model part can only use one Shooting Weapon per phase. A Shooting Weapon typically has an Aim Value, shown in brackets after the name of the weapon. The rules for the Shooting Weapon will define the weapon’s maximum Range, the number of Shots fired, and the Strength, Armour Penetration, and potentially Attack Attributes applied to its attacks.

Name: Keywords
Description:
Model Rules include keywords to help define their effects. These keywords can be used directly within the rulebook, which applies to rules that always have that keyword. Alternatively, keywords can be specified for individual rules on specific models, spells, or weapons. In this case this is done within brackets following the name of the rule.

	Below follows a list of Model Rule keywords:
	
		
  •  Shooting or Melee & Shooting (Attack Attributes only): An Attack Attribute with the keyword Shooting only affects attacks made with Shooting Weapons, while an Attack Attribute with the keyword Melee & Shooting affects both Melee Attacks and attacks made with Shooting Weapons.
		
			
  •  Remember that the default if none of these keywords are used is that Attack Attributes only affect Melee Attacks.
			
  •  For example, by default Poison Attacks affect only Melee Attacks. If a model part has Poison Attacks(Shooting), this means the Poison Attacks rule applies only to attacks made with that model part’s Shooting Weapons, unless it also has Poison Attacks or Poison Attacks(Melee & Shooting).
		

		
  •  Special Attacks: Apply the following rules to Attack Attributes with this keyword. A model with this rule can make a special Melee Attack (which is not a Standard Melee Attack), that hits automatically. Since not a Standard Melee Attack this attack can usually not be made as a Supporting Attack and does not suffer from Restricted Attacks (see Melee chapter). Special Attacks cannot be allocated towards Attachable Models that could not be the target of a Ranged Attack (see Attacks chapter).
		
  •  Cumulative: Effects from multiple instances of a Model Rule with the Cumulative keyword are combined and add up.
		
  •  Distance Modifiers: Denoted as a number followed by ". Any distances in the Model Rule description is replaced by the number. For example, Vanguard(3"") means that the model can perform a Vanguard move, but its Mobility is set to 3" instead of the normal 6".
		
  •  Towards X: The Attack Attribute only applies if the attack is allocated to a specific type of enemy model. The conditions are given as X. If more than one type of enemy is relevant they are separated by or. If multiple conditions must be fulfilled, these conditions are separated by and.	For example, Multiple Wounds(2, towards Height 4 and Beast, or Height 5) means that Multiple Wounds can be used versus models that are both Height 4 and Beast, as well as versus models that are Height 5, regardless of if the model has the Beast Property or not.
		
  •  Against X: The Model Rule only applies when attacked by a certain type of model or with certain Rules or Properties. See the rules under Towards X for how to interpret or and and. For example, Hard Target(against Lethal Strike) means that the model can only use its Hard Target rule when attacked by an attack with Lethal Strike.
		
  •  Unique Keywords: In addition to the standard model rule keywords defined above, certain Model Rules have unique keywords. These are defined in the respective rules themselves.

Name: Introduction
Description:
Welcome to the tabletop wargame known as The 9th Age: Fantasy Battles, or T9A for short. This is a community crafted miniatures wargame, where grand armies collide in monumental conflicts for supremacy and survival. The game is played on a tabletop with terrain features and miniatures to represent the battlefield and the clashing armies, and it uses six-sided dice and measuring devices to move miniatures and resolve actions such as charging into battle, letting arrows loose, and casting spells.

For all the rules, feedback, and suggestions, please visit our webpage: the-ninth-age.com. The rules presented in this book are considered the Core Rules of T9A and are used in all T9A games. \
